meanings.definition: To remove from sight or view.
meanings.sent1: She quickly unsighted the bird by closing the curtains.
meanings.sent2: The magician unsighted the audience with a clever trick.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat unsighted the toy mouse and played a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The fog unsighted the distant mountains, shrouding them in mystery.
meanings.sent5: The detective unsighted the suspect in the crowded market, making a swift capture.

meanings.definition: The act of disappearing from view.
meanings.sent1: The unsighting of the ship puzzled the sailors on the horizon.
meanings.sent2: The unsighting of the comet left the astronomers disappointed.
meanings.sent3: The unsighting of the rabbit in the magician's hat drew gasps from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The unsighting of the sun behind the clouds signaled the start of a rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The unsighting of the rare bird in the forest sparked excitement among birdwatchers.
